Returns: a printable representation of this object.
toString().Description: Returns a string containing a concise, human-readable description of this object. Subclasses are encouraged to override this method and provide an implementation that takes into account the object's type and data. The default implementation is equivalent to the following expression: See toString method.

Returns: the formatted header, in a buffer that must not be modified
getBuffer().Description: Obtains the buffer with the formatted header. The returned buffer MUST NOT be modified.

Parameters: the buffer containing the header to represent
Throws: in case of a parse error
BufferedHeader(org.apache.http.util.Char.Description: Creates a new header from a buffer. The name of the header will be parsed immediately, the value only if it is accessed.

clone().Description: Creates and returns a copy of this Object. The default implementation returns a so-called "shallow" copy: It creates a new instance of the same class and then copies the field values (including object references) from this instance to the new instance. A "deep" copy, in contrast, would also recursively clone nested objects. A subclass that needs to implement this kind of cloning should call super.clone() to create the new instance and then create deep copies of the nested, mutable objects.

Returns: index of the first character of the header value in the buffer returned by @B_org#apache#http#FormattedHeader#getBuffer_E@.
getValuePos().Description: Obtains the start of the header value in the @B_org#apache#http#FormattedHeader#getBuffer_E@. By accessing the value in the buffer, creation of a temporary string can be avoided.

ClassDesc: Please use @B_java#net#URL#openConnection_E@ instead. Please visit This class represents a raw HTTP header whose content is parsed 'on demand' only when the header value needs to be consumed.
